Summary: Bluish white satellite morphs into bigger orange light...
divs: Sighting DetailsWas standing near the beach in Neptune Beach, FL. I was star gazing when I noticed a light that would resemble any other satellite movement. It appeared bluish-white, tiny star like sized, moving at a slow rate. It was definitely well up in the atmosphere, or perhaps stratosphere. I watched the light move in a north-easterly direction, then about 20 seconds of watching this light, it started turning orange-white... It then flared for about 2 seconds before it vanished. There were no clouds, and the moon was not present. Very clear view. There were other very obvious airplanes in their normal traffic patterns.
trends: There have been 3 other sightings in Jacksonville Beach
There were no other sightings in Jacksonville Beach on or around November 21st 2008
